intro: Eriogonum corymbosum var. cronquistii, commonly known as the Cronquist’s stickybush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, shrub-like form. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. This variety is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
